pageContext.claim: “There are a lot of people think that masks are not good. … I'll tell you who those people are -- waiters. They come over and they serve you, and they have a mask. And I saw it the other day where they were serving me, and they're playing with the mask -- I'm not blaming them -- I'm just saying what happens. They're playing with the mask, so the mask is over, and they're touching it, and then they're touching the plate.”
pageContext.analysis: This makes no sense. The coronavirus is known for its airborne transmission. Why would any waiter increase their chances of exposure and their patrons' by refusing a mask? Even in the unusual scenario Trump describes, a mask would be better than no mask.
